docstr: `IOR` â€” Bitwise logical or ### Description `IOR` returns the bitwise Boolean inclusive-OR of `I` and `J`. ### Syntax `RESULT = IOR(I, J)` ### Arguments . | `J` | The type shall be `INTEGER`, of the same kind as `I`. (As a GNU extension, different kinds are also permitted.) ### Return value The return type is `INTEGER`, of the same kind as the arguments. (If the argument kinds differ, it is of the same kind as the larger argument.) ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also IEOR, IAND, IBITS, IBSET, IBCLR, NOT
